intro: Moschkowitzia fagopyroides, commonly known as the mountain buckwheat, is a flowering plant belonging to the Polygonaceae family. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant features broad, lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive hairy texture, and it thrives in alpine and subalpine environments. It is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to cold climates. Moschkowitzia fagopyroides plays a role in stabilizing soil in mountainous regions and supports local pollinator populations.
